text: Sylvia Bernstein (sometimes credited as Sylvia Bernstein Seid or Sylvia Seid) was an American screenwriter and playwright active in Hollywood in the late 1920s. He was born in Brooklyn, and her father was screenwriter Isadore Bernstein. She was of Jewish ancestry. She eventually moved out to Los Angeles with her family, where she began working as a screenwriter. She was married twice: first to Louis Banks and then to John Hartley Seid. == Selected filmography == * The Lariat Kid (1929) * One Splendid Hour (1929) * Montmartre Rose (1929) * The Royal Rider (1929) * Wild Beauty (1927) == References == Category:Jewish American screenwriters Category:American women screenwriters Category:1900 births Category:1979 deaths Category:Screenwriters from New York (state) Category:20th-century American women writers Category:20th-century American screenwriters
